channel.title: A cow gave birth to a horse
channel.description:
[align=center]In a strange natural phenomenon, a cow gave birth to a horse as well as a calf last week in a small hamlet outside of San Pedro de Macoris, in the Dominican Republic.
Salomón Elías, the local Mayor was conducting the delivery of the calf which initially seemed perfectly normal.
After having removed the calf, Elias noted that in there appeared to be another baby in the cow, and when it came to delivery, it turned out it was a “colt” (name given to young horses), that attracted the attention of many.
The owner of the cow, Julio Fernandez, a local businessman said he could not explain the phenomenon, and that was the first time he’d seen anything like it in all his time dealing with animals.
The horse was stillborn, but it was fully formed, as you can see from the photo.
[img]https://www.dominicancentral.com/displayImage.php?phud=rdugey/horse-cow.jpg[/img]
[img]https://www.cronica.com.ar/imgs_noticias/20101021/32624_20101021112511_495x240.jpg[/img]
[url]https://www.dominicancentral.com/newsarticle/the_strange_case_of_a_cow_that_gave_birth_to_a_horse/[/url][/align]

item.title: A cow gave birth to a horse
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
super lurker:

does anyone remember that one time
where the farmer had sex with one of his sheep, and it gave birth to a human faced lamb
this is nothing compared to that.
it was terrifying

Haha, you clearly have no scientific knowledge whatsoever. It was a mutated sheep that just happened to resemble a human. If this story has any truth to it it will be the same; a severely mutated calf that happens to look like a colt. Now it is a tiny bit more plausible as cows and horses are far more similar, but I still doubt it. Animals of one species can’t mate with animals of another species unless the two are incredibly similar.

Read full topic

item.title: A cow gave birth to a horse
item.dc:creator: Fancy_Pants
item.description:
acade366:

What puzzles me is: why was the local Mayor conducting the delivery? didn’t he have anything more important to do?

Also, to FP: why do you assume it’s fake? it probably is, but why is it “obviously” fake?

uh do you know anything about biology at all
when something is literally physically impossible i consider it obviously fake
everyone knows horse sperm cannot fertilize a cow egg which makes it pretty obvious duuuuuuhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh
